data.title: Lost the warning about the number of characters in git commit title when over 50 characters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professsional, SP1

Hi everyone. I don't know since when (i.e if it is since 1.11.0 or before that), but it looks that vscode do not warn users about the number of characters in the git commit title when we write over 50 characters. Before, we had a warning telling us that it is recommanded to write a title below 50 characters. But now, there is no warning anymore.  Is it an issue or this feature is no longuer available ?

Thank you for your answer.

data.title: Zooming the editor breaks webviews
data.body:
![example pic](http://i.imgur.com/BMXZzQh.png)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Zoom in
2. Open up a webview

Zooming in the entire editor seems to mess up webviews. Other parts of VSCode scale properly, but a weird padding is added to the webview (or rather, the height and width properties are too small for the now-zoomed pane)

Changing the width and height of the webview (which are both manually styled in the HTML as 100%) to, for example, 120% if you've zoomed once, then it "fixes" it, but this has to be done manually for every webview which is obviously a big pain haha.

"git push" should not be used under any circumstances, if the local copy has no changes to send to the server.

data.title: A horizontally scrolling column view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

**An editor view that ONLY has a horizontal scroll bar. Text is layed out in columns which are automatically sized to be as wide as the widest text in that column.**

Motivation: Like many programmers I have a gigantic screen, but my ability to see a lot of a single source code file is limited by the vertical height of my screen, meaning I often use less than a 3rd of my screen real-estate. The proposed view would allow me to see much more of my file at once. Opening multiple views on the same file are harder to manage.

This is a feature request, since it doesn't seem possible to add this functionality as a plugin. Alternatively, consider adding enough functionality to the plugin API to make this feature possible.

Optionally: intelligent pagination. Inserting new lines would shift all columns, which may be disorienting. Instead, use the natural indentation of most text files to move text to the next column when the "page break" would be nested more deeply than a configurable amount of spaces. This would ensure most "functions" would be in a single column (not divided), and code would move around between columns much less while editing.

Example, current view, `*` marks the edge of the editor view:

    ***************************
    * code                   S*
    *   code                 C*
    * code                   R*
    *                        O*
    * code                   L*
    *   code                 L*
    ***************************

New proposed view, `.` marks unused space because of pagination:

    ***************************
    * code     code     code  *
    *   code     code         *
    * code       code         *
    *          code           *
    * .....                   *
    * S C R O L L B A R       *
    ***************************

data.title: [Bug] Typing closing bracket ']' in regex search not possible
data.body:
**Description:**
Trying to input the closing bracket `]` in the local search form in Regex mode doesn't work, no errors nor logs, just the bracket never shows, like if i had never pressed the key.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: OSX Sierra

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open local search and activate Regex mode.
2. Try inputting the closing bracket `]`.

**Expected output:**
I expect it to allow me to input the closing bracket `]`.

data.title: Quickly blinking cursor in terminal if you open and quit external app
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10

I think it's a regression in 1.11. I didn't notice such issue in 1.10

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Have set `"terminal.integrated.cursorBlinking": true`
2. Open integrated terminal
3. Run "vi" or "mc" and quit it

**Expected result:**

- the same rate of cursor blinking as before you run the commands

**Actual result:**

- much faster

**Workaround:**

- kill terminal and open again

data.title: Custom defined key binding for git.openChangeFromUri does not work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|
|ActiveFileInStatusBar|RoscoP|1.0.2|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|gitlens|eamodio|3.1.0|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.57|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.5|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.4|
|java|redhat|0.1.0|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.5.0|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.3.5|
|vscode-proto3|zxh404|0.1.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Prior to upgrading to 1.11, I had a keybinding:
`{ "key": "cmd+k cmd+n",       "command": "workbench.action.git.globalOpenChange"  },`
However, in 1.11.1, it seems that this command does not exist (I got an error to that effect when I attempted to use it).  Instead this command is called `git.openChangeFromUri`
2. I updated the keybinding to reflect this:
`{ "key": "cmd+k cmd+n",       "command": "git.openChangeFromUri"  },`

Interestingly, when I type the command in the command pallet, I see my keybinding next to the command:
![screen shot 2017-04-06 at 2 24 38 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20231989/24769525/da0b009c-1ad4-11e7-84ae-c70d077b2ff6.png)

However, when I type the "cmd+k cmd+n", it doesn't actually do anything.  I tried giving it a single non-chord key combination ("alt+n") and it still didn't work.

Note:
- All of my other key bindings seem to work without issue -- including multi-key chords
- Selecting this command from the command pallet -- ie, as in the screenshot above -- causes the command to work as intended.
- I've experienced no other cases where a command works form the command pallet, but whose key-combination does not work (although I haven't looked for this).

data.title: Accessibility: List widget keyboard access to actions
data.body:
All versions:

Both the new SCM and revamped extension viewlits use the new list wg.
If one is using keyboard navigation each of these require several extra steps and duplicated tab stop
or procedure steps. 

Basic example for extensions:

- user has copied a marketplace link or entered a search term
- user has to Tab into extension list
- press X number of Down keys
- press Enter - entry gets focus - default entry action opens extension description in editor
- ActionBar actions for the selective list item cannot be accessed unless user Tab stops
all the way from the beginning back to the install button (or gear icon) 
- knowing where their current tab stop is can be difficult as it might be out of view
and for current contrast level , color and width of the Tab stop highlight is minimal

With new SCM:
- default keyboard action on Enter to select also open file item 
- in order to get the per file item actions the user has to go back to the widget a second time
and then use the available Tab stops to get to the actions

Possible joint solutions:
- Selecting a list item with the keyboard should make the next Tab stop to the action of the item actions
- don't separate focus from selection by keyboard like the old git source widget (actions available on selection)
- use Control Enter to select and activate actions availability or another key
- add user settings item that makes selection and focus overlapped for keyboard only users benefit

I see accessibility items as main part of April milestones.

I would do a PR and work on this if accepted...
Thanks

data.title: Keybindings get locked to selected keyboard when opening program
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

I use Dvorak-QWERTY which maps the keyboard to QWERTY keybindings when pressing CMD. As of my update today, the bindings get locked to whatever keyboard you have open.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode with Dvorak QWERTY keyboard selected
2. CMD+v == CMD+k
2. Change to US keyboard and CMD+v == CMD+k
3. Quit VSCode
4. Open with US keyboard selected
5. CMD+v == CMD+v on all keyboards

Reverted to v1.10.2

data.title: spawn npm ENOENT on windows for npm tasks.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1 (March 2017)
- OS Version: Windows 10, 1607

<kbd>CTRL+SHIFT+B</kbd> for tasks.json with npm task results in:

```
running command> npm run watch-all
Failed to launch external program npm .
spawn npm ENOENT
```

I'm seeing lots of mentions of "spawn npm ENOENT" in google searches and in VSCode open issues, but i don't know that they're the same.

Steps to Reproduce:

I have a tasks.json file with the following configuration.  Various options seem to have no effect - `"cmd"` works as a "command" but nothing with npm.  `"cmd /C echo %PATH%"` and `"cmd /C npm --version"` and `"cmd /C node --version"` all work and give expected (latest) values.  Using cmd to call npm works, but it shouldn't be necessary, won't be cross-platform, and might not work with the background/Problem integration (haven't gotten that far)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17498172/24768134/7e7bb8de-1acf-11e7-82ee-c1a563ab0afc.png)

```
Error: spawn npm ENOENT
    at exports._errnoException (util.js:1026:11)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:193:32)
    at onErrorNT (internal/child_process.js:359:16)
    at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:74:11)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:98:9)
```

```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "npm",
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "echoCommand": true,
            "isBackground": true,
            "taskName": "version",
            "args": ["--version"]
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: Extensions install from marketplace copy item - prompt or install automatically
data.body:
All versions \ OS

When user selects an extension from marketplace and copies install link, does Control+P, Paste, Enter
the extension tops the list in the sidebar and the user has to go through the install and restart.

Since the user already knows the extension and the intent to install it, why not do it automatically?
or at least add an option to allow this. Right now with the new list widget. it actually takes many
keystrokes and tab stops to install the extension (partially a problem of having to tab stop
back to the selected item to access the install button (going to post an improvement on that as well)

Suggested solutions:
- if the user pastes marketplace install link , install and prompt for restart
- same as above but prompt for install/restart
- add flag -f as example to force install immediately
- add user setting eg: always install on marketplace link command

data.title: Copy and paste commands not working on Mac OS

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Highlight text and either use the copy keyboard shortcut or select the copy command from the edit menu.
2. Attempt to paste the copied selection by either using the paste keyboard shortcut or select the paste command from the edit menu.
3. The text does not paste

Additional Info: 
- Keyboard shortcuts are properly assigned
- Cut command works but paste still does not work after cutting text 
- Disabling all extensions did not fix the issue
- Using the command palette to select copy and paste also does not work

data.title: April Iteration Plan
data.body:
This plan captures the focus of our work during the April iteration. It's a 4 week iteration. We will ship **early May**.

The last few iterations were exciting for us. We shipped an abundance of features, and every day we see more new users. With more users comes more activity in our repo:  more PRs, more issues, more discussions. It's a great. Thank you!

We have been trying hard to keep up with everything. But, we feel our issue situation is not in the best possible shape. So, for this iteration, we'll slightly shift our focus: We'll focus more on grooming our issues, fixing bugs, and improving engineering than we'll focus on new features. 

We'll still continue to work on items that have been in flight. For example, last month, we started the exploration to support multi-root workspaces (#396). We'll continue the design and planning work this iteration. BTW, this is a big one and it will take us several iterations to ship it all.

No worries, our release notes will still have a few entries :smile:.


## Endgame
- *April, 25th*: Code freeze for the endgame (_shifted it by one day since we have less new features to test_)
- *April, 28th*: Endgame done

The endgame details for this iteration are tracked in #25250.


## Plan Items

Below is a summary of the top level plan items.

Legend for annotations:

| Mark  | Description |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| :runner: | work in progress  |
| :hand: | blocked task |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration  |
| :large_blue_circle: | more details required |
| :red_circle: | missing issue reference |


### Progress on in-flight items
- [x] :running_man: Investigate into multi-root, multi-folder workspaces #396 @bpasero @tyriar **all**
- [x] :running_man: Additional theming options in the workbench #3112 @aeschli @bpasero **all**
- [x] :running_man: Debug - Complete support for column break points https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-chrome-debug-core/issues/144 @roblourens
- [x] :running_man: SCM Provider API - react to feedback from Adopters, finalize the API #15894 @joaomoreno
- [x] :running_man: Typescript - investigate into TS language server extensions, validate with tslint as a server extension Microsoft/vscode-tslint#171 @mjbvz, @egamma
- [ ] :running_man: PHP - language server contributions https://github.com/felixfbecker/php-language-server/issues/323 @mousetraps
- [x]  Explore emmet 2.0 support #21943 @ramya-rao-a
- [x] Keybindings customization - improved search, duplicate detection #23400 #23368 @sandy081

### Issues we plan to fix
- [Bugs planned for April](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+milestone%3A%22April+2017%22)
- :running_man: Address [accessibility issues](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen%20is%3Aissue%20label%3Aaccessibility%20usability%20in%3Atitle%20OR%20accessibility%20in%3Atitle%20%20-label%3Aupstream%20) 

### Engineering items
- [x] :running_man: Issue categorization, review, assignment #24059 **all**
- Testing
  - [x] [Test Tours](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+Test+Tour+label%3Atestplan-item+milestone%3A%22April+2017%22) to validate with VS Code with popular JS frameworks **all**
  - [x] Test running - support to run tests inside the electron renderer process @jrieken
  - [x] :running_man: Explore the use of [Spectron](https://electron.atom.io/spectron/) for automated UI testing of VS Code @michelkaporin
- [x] :running_man: Update to Electron 1.6 #23159 @bpasero
- Performance
  - [x]  Debug node stepping performance #23743 @isidorn
  - [x]  Investigate into the negative Windows startup time trend @jrieken @ramya-rao-a @seanmcbreen

### Deferred
- Install/update- Investigate into a rolling install-update scheme or to suspend an update without roll back @joaomoreno @bpasero

data.title: Git not autorefreshing
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.11.1
- OS Version:Linux Mint 18

In version 10, if I updated a file and then clicked the "git" icon, the changed files would automatically be listed.  After updating this morning to 1.11.1, I have to take the extra step of clicking the "refresh" icon in the source:control:git window to see the change list.  I looked at the git settings under preference and git.autorefresh:true is set.

data.title: File icons for default languages outside of VS Code (icons in Finder)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
## Description

I would like to be able to distinguish my Objective-C .h, .m, Markdown, and Swift (and any other programming/markup language) files from one another in the Finder when VS Code is set to be the default app for opening these files. Currently all the files show the same VS Code document icon. When files are set to be opened by Xcode by default the file icons are different based on their type. Additionally it would be nice if external packages could dictate different images for different file types.

## Steps to Reproduce

Set VS Code to be the default app for opening Objective-C and Swift files.
View file icons in Finder
#### Expected behavior: [What you expected to happen]

File icons are different based on the file type.

#### Actual behavior: [What actually happened]

File icons are all the same VS Code document icon.

data.title: Git sync animiation not shown
data.body:
When you click on "Synchonize Changes" in status bar, Git sync animiation in status bar not shown anymore with 1.11.1. Prior to 1.11.0 animation was shown. Is this intentional? Or is it a new setting now?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16571328/24767533/907444ae-1aff-11e7-8611-b18386cac081.png)

data.title: Delete, Insert, Home, End, PgUp, PgDn, and arrow keys no longer work editor in 1.11
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-1488387854
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try to use any of Delete, Insert, Home, End, PgUp, PgDn, or arrow keys (UpArrow, DownArrow, LeftArrow, RightArrow) while in the editor
2. Observe that the editor does not respond.

When I started up Visual Studio Code after upgrading I got a warning that it messed with my keybindings. I've inspected them and I don't see anything that has changed. Downgrading to 1.10.2 resolves the issue.

data.title: Pasting code in the console (powershell) provokes a 'tab' keystroke
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Navigate with the console (Powershell) to a directory with more than one file
2. Write something in the console (anything)
3. Copy any text to the clipboard
4. Right click on the console (should paste the text)

Actual Result:
You'll get the name of the first file in the directory + your copied contents pasted. This is likely because VS Code would be interpreting the right click as Tab + Right Click (just an assumption).
